content.description:
The People's Buttress has varied face climbing throughout. The crux is about 20' up.

Use a 70m rope, and be careful not to lower the climber off the end, as it will be just long enough.
content.location: Start off a huge block, and climb the arete and buttress that marks the right side of the Emperor Wall.

content.description: On the far left side of the Emperor Wall, climb the water streaked left leaning crack to a stance. Climb back right and up to the seam and finger crack.
content.protection: Three bolts and gear to 2.5 inches.

content.description:
Ten draws are needed for this fun, bolt protected route that can be broken into three short pitches. There are good coffee table-sized belay ledges.

P1. .10b, 70'. This is nice climbing out an arch to a corner.

P2. .10d, 90'. This is pumpy climbing on good edges.

P3. .10b, 60'. Climb left onto the face at the last bolt (.10b) or balance straight up the corner (.11b).

Rap the route with one 60m rope.

climbs.name: The Emperor Wall
climbs.fa: P1 Justin Talbot 2012, P2 Justin Talbot, 2014

content.description:
P1. .12, 90.  Thin, balancy and sometime powerful climbing characterize this pitch. The first 50 to a no hands rest is about .11a (intermediate anchor here). The next 40 is .12aish and a 15 traverse right ends in a hard move to left facing flakes. Bolts protect the pitch.

P2. .13a, 100.  Start up the shallow, left-facing corner, then traverse up and left to a 60 flared crack/groove to the top. There are several .12 sections in a row with little rest in between.

Rappel

Finback

with a 60m rope.
content.protection:
P1. Bolts.

P2. Bolts and three or four medium cams for the final 50'.
